intro: Osmoglossum pulchellum f. dormanianum, commonly known as the Dormanian's beauty bellflower, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant features showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped leaves with a silvery underside, adding to its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
